text: SSAStepper has some strange behavior, where it seems to can fire a transition if some quantity q>0 before the transition (as opposed to after the transition being q>0), making it negative after the transition fires. Or maybe it assumes the probability of two events firing simultaneously/concurrently is negligable.

Late to the game here, but feel free to open a DiffEqJump issue or let us know in diffeq-bridged if you are having SSAStepper issues. The aggregators definitely assume only one jump is executed per event, and two distinct `ConstantRateJump`s or `MassActionJump`s can never have the same jump time.

elements.text: Late to the game here, but feel free to open a DiffEqJump issue or let us know in diffeq-bridged if you are having SSAStepper issues. The aggregators definitely assume only one jump is executed per event, and two distinct
s can never have the same jump time.

text: In `Direct` I can't really even see how the algorithm would possibly give multiple events, since a single next event time is sampled and then the event at that time is separately sampled based on the current transition rates.

elements.text: I can't really even see how the algorithm would possibly give multiple events, since a single next event time is sampled and then the event at that time is separately sampled based on the current transition rates.

text: The basic method in a given timestep is to `execute_jumps` and then `generate_jumps`.
